group_1.narration: Since then, Hanna has been coming to the shop@and helping me with my work.
Thanks to her, the shop was running smoothly.@Within a week, many different customers started coming in,@and our reputation soared.
As a result,@when we walk through the shopping district,@people are now more willing to talk to us,@to accept us in a friendly manner...
It feels like I'm living a completely different life...@A life I could have never dreamed of...

group_1.textLeft: Phew, I'm taking a short break.

group_1.textRight: Okay, I'll make some tea for you.
You're doing well for someone who can't@drink coffee.
No, you're great, Sena.
...What's the owner doing?@She's leaving everything to you.

group_1.textLeft: Seems like she has another job@and wants to focus on that now.

group_1.textRight: What the fuck...

group_1.textLeft: It's fine... She's not forcing me to work...
Besides...it's just the two of us now,@and no one's bothering us...
It feels like we have our own shop...@I'm happy.

group_1.textRight: Sena...
I was heating a pot and the bottom came off.@What should I do?

group_1.textLeft: Hanna, for now, turn off the fire! Fire!

group_1.textRight: O-Okay.
...Sorry for bothering you while you're busy,@but I'd like to have some of your fruit punch.
I-I just really wanted to drink it...
...Sena, where are you going?

group_1.textLeft: It seems the fruit punch is a secret menu item.
I have to tell the owner when an order comes in.

group_1.textRight: ...Oh, I see.
Did an order for fruit punch come in?
Well, here...that's all for today.@You can leave now.
You two have been working hard,@and it makes my main job easier...
Today is special! Christmas is coming soon,@so why don't you go have fun?
Of course...@You've been helping.

group_1.textLeft: Let's go, Hanna.@I want to eat something.

group_1.textRight: Hm, okay...
Have fun!

group_1.narration: I brought Hanna to a crepe shop and ordered@a crepe filled with plenty of strawberries,@chocolate, and whipped cream.
Hanna's crepe had tuna and corn in cheese sauce.@I thought that was good too, but...@I still preferred the sweet one.
And while the two of us ate,@we walked through the town colored by Christmas...
...I've always wanted to do things like this.
Dropping by the crepe shop with friends after school,@then going shopping in town...
The normal life that I couldn't reach back then@and everything that was sparkling far away@were now here.

group_1.textRight: We can't go inside the shop because@we're eating crepes.

group_1.textLeft: It's a waste of time, if we go in now.

group_1.textRight: A waste...?

group_1.textLeft: Hey, Hanna...after this, let's go shopping a lot.
Or do you prefer karaoke? Or bowling!

group_1.textRight: There's so much to do.

group_1.narration: Happiness fills my heart so much that it hurts.@This pain is so delightful...@Even if I can't breathe, it doesn't matter@because I'm so happy...
If my world is sparkling this much now,@I wonder what will happen on Christmas Day...
This year, I'll spend Christmas with Hanna,@and it will definitely be the best Christmas ever.@I'm sure I'll choke on my sparkling emotions...
And then I'll think to myself,@"I've lived through hell for this moment..."

group_1.textCenter: I'm so happy I can't even breathe.
